publicationPlace: Emprented at Marlborow in the la[nde of Hessen [i.e. Antwerp]
title: A compendious olde treatyse, shewynge howe that we oughte to haue ye scripture in Englysshe
author: Ullerston, Richard, d. 1423.
publicationDate: in the yere of owre lorde MCCCCC. and. XXX. 1530]
publisher: Be my Hans Luft [i.e. J. Hoochstraten],
notes: "This is a mid-15th-century revision, with some further 16th-century linguistic modernization, of an English redaction by an unidentifiable Lollard of a Latin text composed by [Richard] Ullerston"--H&L, citing A. Hudson, EHR 90 (1975), p. 1-18. Previously attributed to John Purvey.
Jerome Barlowe, William Tyndale, and William Roy have each been suggested as editor.
The imprint, from colophon, is false; in fact printed at Antwerp by J. Hoochstraten (STC).
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
